comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I think that it would be safe to say that the three gentlemen in uniform were police officers?  Great old shot, a pity there are no names of location to go with it!

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I've also seen 19th century pics of Customs officers and water-police wearing jackets similar to the one worn by the chap in the middle (must have been a real pain to iron with all those ornamental tag things on the front). Along with the regular police, it might be worth placing Customs officers and water-police on the list of suspects. nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71589038 these 1907 T&CJ pics of senior NSW police figures show them wearing different caps to the one worn by the chap in the middle of this pic... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article113867238 this 1902 Evening News pic of Inspector Potter shows a somewhat different jacket (also an ironing nightmare!) to the one worn by the chap in the middle... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71283502 T&CJ pics of NSW police in 1898...the chaps in blue have crests on their helmets... images.slsa.sa.gov.au/searcy/02/PRG280_1_2_497.htm vaguely similar cap and badge
